definition: to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: With his head stuck on the ground, the poor man acknowledged her kindness and beckoned the woman to go away.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐善解人意地趴在地上擺了擺手，示意女人離開。

sentences.english: Little Bear nodded, waved his hand, and hurried along on his bee-line journey;
sentences.chinese: 小熊點點頭，擺擺手，然後很快就開始了他的旅途。

sentences.english: When he saw her, he waved.
sentences.chinese: 他一看見她就擺了擺手。

sentences.english: Father smiled and waved his hand, eyes showing imperceptible sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸苦笑着擺了擺手，眼睛裏流露出不易覺察的悲傷。

sentences.english: He waved good-bye to fans and left the concert hall through the back exit.
sentences.chinese: 他和歌迷們擺手再見，從後門出去了。

sentences.english: I told her mother put a hand and gestured her out.
sentences.chinese: 我對她母親擺擺手，示意她出去。

sentences.english: Uncle and aunt are in a hurry motioning with his hand, said he cant for her money.
sentences.chinese: 叔叔和姑姑都急着擺手，說自己不能要她的錢。

sentences.english: I immediately comprehended that I should have waved my palm gently (instead of punching heavily) to receive the blessing force from limitless oneness.
sentences.chinese: 我即悟當輕柔擺手，方能領受無限一體之加持力。

sentences.english: She declined the offer with a wave of her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她擺了擺手謝絕了這一提議。

sentences.english: Does the baby wave or point at things?
sentences.chinese: 是否嬰兒會擺手或者指着某些東西？

sentences.english: Oh, you know, " he waved a dismissive hand."
sentences.chinese: “哦，你知道的，”他不滿的擺了擺手。

sentences.english: Made Mo to take time to put to put a hand, the bamboo son pulled those people.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨抽空擺了擺手，竹兒將那些人拉起來。

sentences.english: I pointed to the pile and offered to help, but she waved me away.
sentences.chinese: 我示意要幫忙，但她擺擺手拒絕了。

definition: to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
